result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MICHAEL J THORSON

defendant.name: THORSON, MICHAEL J
defendant.address: W18033 E MOHAWK ST, WITTENBERG, WI 54499

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM Defendant MICHAEL J THORSON in court.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant wanted to waive his right to an attorney,  Keep the case moving along.  Atty waiver form presented to defendant.  Form provided to Judge.  
Defendant wants to waive his right to an attorney in all 7 cases today if possible.  Only 1 case was scheduled for today.  The others didn't track along.  These will be all rescheduled together for another status of attorney because there may be victims in other cases as well.    Defendant will review the form.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Pictures & prints.  No contact with M.C. (dob 7/2/1982).

2:20 PM Defendant MICHAEL J THORSON appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with.  Court advises party of the charges.  Defendant wishes to waive counsel in all these matters. Before Court will accept waiver, the defendant should appear in person in the courtroom.  Court enters a NG plea this case.  State requests a $500.00 signature bond with conditions.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
